name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysplasia with Accessory Navicular Syndrome
chief_complaint: I have this painful bump on my inner foot that makes walking unbearable, and my arch is collapsing
physical_findings: Palpable bony prominence at medial midfoot
treatment: Custom orthotics with medial arch support
Stage II posterior tibial tendon reconstruction
Accessory navicular excision with tendon reattachment
prognosis: Guarded - depends on degree of deformity correction and tendon integrity restoration. Full return to high-impact activities unlikely without surgical intervention.
description: A complex congenital/acquired foot deformity combining dysplastic posterior tibial tendon anatomy with a symptomatic type II accessory navicular bone, leading to progressive adult-acquired flatfoot deformity. The dysplastic tendon fails to support the medial arch, while the accessory bone creates mechanical irritation.
multiple_choice: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysplasia with Accessory Navicular Syndrome
